data.title: Norwegian Winter Olympic Medalist Introduction - Halvard Hanevold, Torger Nergard, Anders Aukland, Eirik Kvalfoss, Martin Stixrud, Olav Jordet (Paperback)
data.meta_description: Please note that the content of this book primarily consists of articles available from Wikipedia or other free sources online. Pages: 170. Not illustrated. Chapters: Halvard Hanevold, Torger Nergard, Anders Aukland, Eirik Kvalfoss, Martin Stixrud, Olav Jordet, Flemming Davanger, Ole Stenen, Sture Sivertsen, Magnar Solberg, Ole Gunnar Fidjestol, Eigil Ramsfjell, Jan Thoresen, Bent Anund Ramsfjell, Lars Vagberg, Terje Langli, Frode Ronning, Pal Gunnar Mikkelsplass, Torbjorn Falkanger, Knut Tore Apeland, Alexia Bryn, Kjersti Buaas, Annette Sikveland, Olav Okern, Petter Hugsted, Thorleif Schjelderup, Thoralf Stromstad, Hakon Brusveen, Jon Istad, Kjell Storelid, Audun Gronvold, Inger Aufles, Magnar Estenstad, Hans Petter Buraas, Jan Einar Thorsen, Villy Haugen, Odd Lirhus, Babben Enger-Damon, Ola Waerhaug, Stine Lise Hattestad, Marianne Dahlmo, Erik Johnsen, Tore Torvbraten, Kaare Wahlberg, Kenneth Braaten, Hans Beck, Solveig Pedersen, Thomas Byberg, Reidar Odegaard, Einar Ostby, Dag Bjorndalen, Bjarne Iversen, Ole Hegge, Alf Andersen, Ole Christian Eidhammer, Anthon Grimsmo, Rolf Storsveen, Reidar Nyborg, Jon Inge Kjorum, Lars Grini, Einar Sagstuen, Erling Evensen, Stig-Arne Gunnestad, Torgeir Brandtzaeg, Narve Bonna, Arne Johansen, Mikal Kirkholt, Kjell Sobak, Lisbeth Korsmo, Johs Harviken, Guttorm Berge, Marit Myrmael, Per Knut Aaland, Jon Snersrud, Olav Hagen, Aslaug Dahl, Andreas Krogh. Excerpt: Halvard Hanevold (born December 3, 1969 in Asker), is a Norwegian biathlete and Olympic champion. Hanevold won the bronze medal in the men's 20 km individual and the silver medal in the men's 10 km sprint at the 2006 Winter Olympics. He also medaled in biathlon events at the 1998 Winter Olympics and the 2002 Winter Olympics by winning his first Olympic gold followed by another gold four years later. He won the last medal of his Olympic career in the 4 x 7.5 km relay at the Vancouver 2010 Winter Olympics. In his career he recorded 40 podiums at World Cup level, with the las undefined Books
